properties.address: The Green, Amington, Tamworth, Staffs B77 4AD
properties.description: Place of Welcome opens EVERY Thursday 2-4pm (apart from Christmas holidays) for drinks, cakes, quizzes, jigsaws and occasional craft, all ages welcome - free of charge, donations welcome. Baby Ark is a Stay and Play for Babies and their carers - Monday 1:30 - 3:00pm Term time ONLY and The Amington Ark is for Pre-schoolers and their carers - Thursday morning 9:00 - 11:30am Term time ONLY. Find us on Facebook to book a space for the Ark activities.
properties.title: Amington Parish Church

properties.address: Wesley Hall, , Warwickshire CV7 8FR
properties.description: SPACE OPENING ON 9th November 2023** Church Hall offering tea, coffee, cup-a-soup, biscuits. A warm social space, free for all. With jigsaws, games and books swap.
properties.title: Arley Warm hub

properties.address: Long Street, Atherstone, Warwickshire CV9 1AX
properties.description: Every Monday 2pm-4pm - Join us in the library for a nice, relaxing sit down and cuppa with informal chat and small talk. Please feel free to bring your favourite mug or travel cup, we'll provide the rest. We look forward to meeting you. Full range of free library services available during opening hours with a programme of free activities for children and families. See also www.facebook.com/atherstonelibrary
properties.title: Atherstone Library & Information Service

properties.address: Heath End Church, Warwickshire CV10 7JB
properties.description: Coffee & Chat is open to all. We serve free hot and cold drinks and biscuits. It's a social time with people enjoying the opportunity to chat to other guests and the volunteers.
properties.title: Coffee & Chat

properties.address: Church Street, Nuneaton , Warwickshire.gov.uk CV11 4DR
properties.description: We look forward to meeting you for a weekly Wednesday Warm Welcome, drop-in 2-4pm for games, puzzles, activities & chat. Refreshments available. See below for special events: times may vary, some activities bookable. Craftacular - the art of paper folding crafts, places limited, please book a place in the library or online at: https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/o/nuneaton-library-information-centre-71423659183 3rd January (book from 15th Dec) 8th February (book from 3rd Jan) 6th March (book from 8th Feb) History talks by Eddie Smallwood, no need to book, 2pm start (Unfortunately the talks scheduled for 25th Jan & 21st Feb have been cancelled. We apologise for any inconvenience) 20th March - ‘A Crowning Glory’ – The history, traditions and mistakes of Coronations of English Monarchs FREE Healthy Heart checks by George Eliot Community Health team, Drop-in on 6th March 10am -1pm Refreshments available Full range of library services available during opening hours with a programme of free activities for children and families.
properties.title: Nuneaton Library & Information Service

properties.address: Salvation Army, Victoria Street, Nuneaton, Warwickshire CV11 5QE
properties.description: SPACE OPENING ON 8th November 2023** Open from 8th November 2023. Drop in Breakfast is open to all. We serve free hot and cold drinks and biscuits and a subsidised breakfast. It's a social time with people enjoying the opportunity to chat to other guests and the volunteers.
properties.title: Nuneaton Salvation Army

properties.address: Bridge Street , Warwickshire B78 1DT
properties.description: Call in to Polesworth Library for a hot drink and a chat every Tuesday morning between 10.30 and 12noon. Free! We look forward to meeting you. Full range of free library services available in opening hours with a programme of free activities for children and families.
properties.title: Polesworth Library & Information Service

properties.address: St Martin's Church & Centre, Tamworth, Staffordshire B77 4JA
properties.description: Our coffee shop is open on Tuesday mornings and we offer refreshments after our Sunday services, anyone is welcome to come along to these! Families only on Thursdays at the Make Lunch sessions - these aren't monthly but there was no other option to choose! Dates are always in the school holidays and are advertised on our Facebook page Make Lunch Stonydelph.
properties.title: St Martin in the Delph

properties.address: Stockingford Library, St Paul's Rd, Warwickshire CV10 8HW
properties.description: We invite you to join us every Wednesday from 10th January 2024 for coffee and conversation at Ford Chats, 11am -12. Just drop-in, no need to book. Refreshments available. Additional activities on some weeks: 1st Wednesday, 10am -11am - 'For d'love of books' reading group. All welcome to listen or participate. 3rd Wednesday, 10am -12 - Discover your family history with help from the Nuneaton Local History Group. 4th Wednesday, 10am -12 - Tea & Tech drop-in. Want to improve your digital skills? Get support with your queries and boost your confidence with technology in a friendly and informal setting. Bring your own device or use ours Full range of library services available during opening hours with a programme of free activities for children and families.

Wednesday’s Warm Welcome – A FREE warm space with board games, puzzles and refreshments provided every Wednesday. Also occasional speakers & special events.

properties.address: Stockingford Nursery School, Children & Family Centre & Library, St Paul's Rd, Stockingford CV10 8HW
properties.description:
Ford Chats – We invite you to join us every Wednesday for coffee and conversation at Ford Chats 11am-12.

Additional activities also available, all drop-in and all FREE with refreshments included:

1st Wednesday, 10am -11am – ‘For d’love of books’ reading group. All welcome to listen or participate

3rd Wednesday, 10am -12 – Discover your family history with help from the Nuneaton Local History Group.

4th Wednesday, 10am -12 – Tea & Tech drop-in. Want to improve your digital skills? Get support with your queries and boost your confidence with technology in a friendly and informal setting. Bring your own device or use ours.
